description: From Ecclesiastical Latin abbreviātor. Compare French abbréviateur.

entries.meaning: A person who abbreviates or shortens. [from early 16th c.]

(Roman Catholicism, historical) One of a college of seventy-two officers of the papal court whose duty was to make a short minute of a decision on a petition, or reply of the pope to a letter, and afterwards expand the minute into official form. [from mid-16th c.]
